result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) and Operating w/ PAC (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Jamie M Sullivan was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Jamie M Sullivan was found guilty of Operate Firearm While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
**  Pay fine of $1300.00   and court costs including all applicable surcharges - for Ct 1 &   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges - in Ct 2.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided.
** Pay DNA surcharges.  Cts 1 & 2 pay Advocate Counsel fees.

timeConds.notes: Huber Allowed.  Not eligible for Electronic Leg Monitor.Unless work crew is expressly prohibited by the Court, an inmate serving time as a condition of probation is eligible for work crew and may receive a credit of one day for every 3 days of work performed.

records.addlTxt: Terminated - Regular on 11-4-16
Terminated - Regular on 11-4-16
Release of court ordered prosecution costs;  ck#16CH076251
16R 016699 - receipted to incorrect case - corrected 7/27/16 mg
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge
For Ct 1 only
For Cts 3,4 & 5 only - Dismissed and read in.
Petition and Order for Other Prosecution Costs totaling $140.00

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State. Defendant, Jamie M Sullivan, appeared with Attorney Mark D. Richards.  Clerk: PT
Case is resolved.  Counts 1 & 2 - DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Counts 3, 4 and 5 - Dismissed and Read In.  Sentencing arguments made.  
Count 1 - Court imposes and stays 270 days in the KCJ.  Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 1 year.  See conditions.  As a condition court imposes 90 days in the KCJ commencing at 5:00 PM today.  Huber & Work Crew authorized, but DE is not eligible for the Electronic Leg Monitor.   DE is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  Court imposes a fine of $1300.00 plus costs & surcharges.  Any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  DE's driving privileges are revoked for 30 months.  AODA Assessment and Ignition Interlock is ordered.

Count 2 - Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 1 year concurrent with Count 1.  See conditions.  As a condition court imposes 90 days in the KCJ commencing at 5:00 PM today concurrent with Count 1.  DE is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  Any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.   

Parties stipulate to prosecution costs in the amount of $140.00  Cash Bond on deposit to be applied to all costs between both counts.  Appeal Rights given.
